pageTitle: HR 2922, a blue subgiant star in Puppis
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {7927=)   HR 2922, 2054=Sky position: RA 7h 35.4m, Dec -28° 22.2', 1617=HR 2922 is a blue subgiant star in the constellation Puppis. At 224 light years away, it shines at an apparent visual magnitude of 4.65. HR 2922 is the primary component of a multiple-star system. It is moving through the Galaxy at a speed of 20.4 km/s relative to the Sun. Its projected Galactic orbit carries it between 24,000 and 33,400 light years from the center of the Galaxy., 2156=Common designations: p Puppis, HIP 36917, HD 60863, HR 2922, 7418=)   HR 2881, 1514=HR 2922 (HIP 36917), 10423=)   HR 2762}
